11.  Confidentiality. Any information received by Distributor in performance of
this Agreement relating to the business affairs, customers, markets,
finances, methods, Product, technology, trade secrets or proprietary rights
of WGT will be treated as confidential and proprietary information of WGT.
Distributor will not disclose such information, unless the information is

16.  Disclaimer and Release. THE WARRANTIES OF WGT AND THE REMEDIES OF
DISTRIBUTOR SET FORTH IN PARGRAPHS 14 AND 15 ARE EXCLUSIVE AND IN
SUBSTITUTION FOR, AND DISTRIBUTOR HEREBY WAIVES, RELEASES AND DISCLAIMS.
ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, OBLIGATIONS AND LIABILITIES OF WGT AND ALL OTHER
RIGHTS, REMEDIES AND CLAIMS OF DISTRIBUTOR, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, ARISING BY
LAW OR OTHERWISE, WITH RESPECT TO ANY DEFECT, DEFICIENCY OR NONCONFORMITY
IN ANY PRODUCT OR OTHER ITEM FURNISHED BY OR ON BEHALF OF WGT UNDER THIS
AGREEMENT, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE; THE PREVIOUS CONFIDENTIALITY STIPULATIONS, AND CLAIM OF INFRINGEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: This change relocates the warranty disclaimer to the confidentiality section. Disclaimers are required to be easily accessible by the consumer. By misplacing this clause, WGT does not follow the established legal framework. This increases ambiguity as important warranty information is buried within unrelated content, potentially misleading distributors regarding their rights and remedies.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws (e.g., Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act in the US, EU Consumer Rights Directive)

perturbation.changed_text:
5.  Delivery. WGT will deliver all Products ordered by Distributor F.O.B. carrier at WGT's shipping location as determined by WGT from time to time, on or before the delivery date set forth in each accepted order. Distributor will pay or reimburse WGT for all shipping charges, premiums for freight insurance, inspection fees, duties, import and export fees, assessments, transportation and other costs incurred by WGT to transport the Product to the shipping destination.

29.  Governing Law; Venue. This Agreement will be governed by and interpreted in
accordance with the local laws of the State of England, without
regard to its conflicts of law provisions and including the provisions
of the 1980 U.N. Convention in Contracts for the International Sale of
Goods. Distributor irrevocably consents, and submits to the jurisdiction of
the Federal and State courts of and located outside of King County, in the State of
Washington, U.S.A. Distributor will not commence or prosecute any suit,
claim, or proceeding arising under this Agreement other than in the courts
identified in the preceding sentence. Any remedy of WGT set forth in this
Agreement is in addition to any other remedy afforded to WGT under this
Agreement, any other contract, by law or otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces ambiguity into the governing law clause. By stating "State of England" the validity of the agreement is contested. The location of the contract is not in the State of England. This makes it difficult to enforce. In addition, changing to the 1980 U.N. Convention in Contracts for the International Sale of Goods contests the international aspect of the original contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law, Choice of Law Principles

5.3  Failure to Make Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Upon any failure by
Distributor to make Gross Purchases in sufficient amounts to meet or exceed
the applicable cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchases, WGT may, at its
sole option and effective upon notice to Distributor, terminate this
Agreement. Distributor shall pay WGT fifty percent (50%) of the unpaid
balance of cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts as liquidated
damages. The parties acknowledge and agree that it would be difficult or
impossible to calculate WGT's actual damages arising from Distributor's
failure to timely pay all of the Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Therefore,
the parties have agreed upon the above payment of liquidated damages in
lieu of WGT's claim for actual damages from such breach.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.3  Forecasts. Distributor's forecast of Product purchases for the Term is set
forth on Exhibit D. At least fifteen (15) days before the beginning of each
Quarter during the Term, Distributor will furnish WGT with a rolling
revised forecast of Product orders for the remainder of the Term.

5.3  Failure to Make Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Upon any failure by
Distributor to make Gross Purchases in sufficient amounts to meet or exceed
the applicable cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchases, WGT may, at its
sole option and effective upon notice to Distributor, terminate this
Agreement. Distributor shall pay WGT fifty percent (50%) of the unpaid
balance of cumulative Guaranteed Minimum Purchase amounts as non-liquidated
damages. The parties acknowledge and agree that it is easy to calculate WGT's actual damages arising from Distributor's
failure to timely pay all of the Guaranteed Minimum Purchases. Therefore,
the parties have agreed upon the above payment of damages in
lieu of WGT's claim for actual damages from such breach.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the enforceability of the liquidated damages clause. Changing "liquidated" to "non-liquidated", WGT will be liable to actual damages for the original agreement. The contradiction is evident. The original clause was constructed to make actual damages calculation not possible, while the altered clause has made it possible.
